description: mounted on ivory paper with tan, grey and gold borders; two sketches of female statue in contrapposto pose at right and left edges of paper; central sketch of a bearded man wearing a cap at center bottom
medium: Pen and brown ink over black chalk on laid paper
provenance: [Paul Wallraf, London]. [Richard Day, London, until 1976; sold, August 4, for Â£450, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1976-d. 2010; bequeathed to the MIA)
title: Studies of a Nude Female Statue (Venus) and Head of a Mature Bearded Man (recto); Architectural Studies (verso)
